bestBHT.bht: If by stating unpleasant truths, if by bringing out all the counsel of God, I may provoke to emulation and awaken up to zeal, then I will have succeeded. It is my duty as a minister of the word to save some of them, my own flesh. Through preaching, the Spirit of God works inwardly to produce powerful effects, effecting the salvation of the faithful. The apostle argues from his useful office to prove that the rejection of the Jews was not total.

Albert Barnes: If by any means - If even by stating unpleasant truths, if by bringing out all the counsel of God...
I may provoke to emulation - I may awaken up to zeal, or to an earnest desire to obtain the like blessings.
No wise man would excite a storm and tempest that might require infinite power to subdue, when the same object could be gained with comparative peace, and under the mild influence of love.
Marvin Vincent: Some of them. A modest expression which recalls Paul 's limited success among his own countrymen.
John Calvin: Observe here that the minister of the word is said in some way to save those whom he leads to the obedience of faith.
We ought at the same time to understand that preaching is an instrument for effecting the salvation of the faithful.
Though it can do nothing without the Spirit of God, yet through his inward operation it produces the most powerful effects.
Philip Schaff: The faithful discharge of his duty to the Gentiles had this as its attempted result."
My own flesh; comp. chap. Romans 9:3."
Save some of them, i.e., of the Jews. Notice the modesty of the expression.
John Gill: What he had in view, even in discharging his office among the Gentiles with so much labour, assiduity, and indefatigableness, was, that if possible he might stir up the Jews to emulate and imitate the Gentiles, in seeking after Christ.

The ministers of the Gospel may be said to save souls, not efficiently, for the author or efficient cause of salvation is God only; the Father has chose unto it, the Son has effected it, and the Spirit applies it.
Now the apostle argues from his office, and the usefulness of it, to some among the Jews, to saving purposes, to prove that their rejection was not total.

bhtAttempts.bht: If by bringing out all the counsel of God, if by stating truths that may be unpleasant, I may provoke to emulation and awaken up to zeal, then I will have succeeded. It is my duty as a minister of the word to save some of them, my own flesh, even though I have had limited success among my own countrymen. Through preaching, an instrument for effecting the salvation of the faithful, the Spirit of God works inwardly to produce powerful effects. The apostle argues from his office and its usefulness to prove that the rejection of the Jews was not total.

If by stating unpleasant truths, if by bringing out all the counsel of God, I may provoke to emulation and awaken up to zeal, then I will have succeeded. It is my duty as a minister of the word to save some of them, my own flesh. Through preaching, the Spirit of God works inwardly to produce powerful effects, effecting the salvation of the faithful. The apostle argues from his useful office to prove that the rejection of the Jews was not total.

If by stating unpleasant truths, if by bringing out all the counsel of God, I may provoke to emulation and awaken up to zeal, then I will have succeeded. It is my duty as a minister of the word to save some of them, my own flesh. Through preaching, the Spirit of God works inwardly to produce powerful effects, effecting the salvation of the faithful. The apostle argues from his useful office to prove that the rejection of the Jews was not total.

If by stating unpleasant truths and bringing out all the counsel of God, I may provoke others to emulation and awaken them to zeal, then I will have fulfilled my duty as a minister of the word. Saving some of my own flesh, the Jews, is my modest aim. Through preaching, the Spirit of God inwardly works to produce powerful effects and bring about salvation. The apostle's useful office confirms that the rejection of the Jews was not total.

If by stating unpleasant truths, by bringing out all the counsel of God, and by awakening up to zeal through emulation, I may provoke others to seek salvation, then I will have fulfilled my role as a minister of the word. Saving some of my own flesh, the Jews, is my modest aim. Through preaching, the Spirit of God works inwardly to produce powerful effects, effecting the salvation of the faithful. The apostle's useful office confirms that the rejection of the Jews was not total.
